intro: Caraipa llanorum subsp. llanorum, commonly known as the Llanorum caraipa, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats and is adapted to seasonal droughts. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its inflorescence consists of small, clustered flower heads. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
